title: Vladimir Bukovsky, dissident who fought Soviet tyranny before and after his expulsion from the USSR in 1976 – obituary
text:
Vladimir Bukovsky, who has died aged 76, was a prominent Russian dissident who spent 12 years in Soviet prisons, forced-labour camps and psychiatric hospitals until 1976, when he was exchanged by the Soviet regime for the Chilean Communist party leader Luis Corvalán, who was being held in detention by the Pinochet regime.

Banished from his homeland, Bukovsky settled in Cambridge, where he rebuilt his life around the struggle to free his homeland and wrote books about his experiences, including a memoir, To Build a Castle: My Life as a Dissenter (1978). He continued to speak out against Soviet oppression and, after the end of communism, tried to galvanise opposition to president Vladimir Putin,...
